result.execSummary:
The defendant Darius J Hunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combiation of both to equal full time, must be at least 40 hours a week.

No contact direct or indirect with Maurice Harper or D'Angelo Harper or other individuals who are on DOC supervision except of course when reporting to agent.
Not have a group of friends who are under supervision.
Maintain absolute sobriety 
 Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Sign necessary releases.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Comply with any other assessments as deemed appropraite by the agent.
Sign releases of information forms for agent to monitor.
Provide DNA sample if not done so.
Must obtain GED.
Reside with grandmother or another residential arrangment approved by DOC 
Grandmother can come and pick up Defendant after 17 days of jail.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice returned

Final Reminder Notice with request to pay in full or set up payment plan has been sent to the Defendant's address in the file as of this date. 
Failure to pay or set up payment plan--warrant to be issued.

Defendant Darius J Hunt in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Darius J Hunt in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent is also present.

4:07 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a sentencing hearing today.
Court did order a PSI. Report was prepared, each party received a copy.

State has no corrections from a factual standpoint.
Atty Schmidt has corrections to state, for the record.

Neither party are calling witnesses.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Jail credit is discussed.
Atty Schmidt addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court questions Defendant. Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court has a number of concerns, as stated on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Prison Sentence for 5 years, Imposed and Stayed
Initial Confinement of 2 years 6 months
Extended Supervision of 2 years 6 months
Eligible for challenge incarceration and Eligible for earned release 
Probation for a period of 3 years
Conditions:
No contact direct or indirect with Maurice Harper or D'Angelo  Harper or other individuals who are on DOC supervision except of course when reporting to agent
Not have a group of friends who are under supervision
Complete an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety 
 Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy
Sign necessary releases
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Comply with any other assessments as deemed appropraite by the agent
Sign releases of information forms for agent to monitor 
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combiation of both to equal full time, must be at least 40 hours a week
Provide DNA sample if not done so  
Must obtain GED
Jail sentence of 220 Days in 
203 days jail credit
17 more days to do
Reside with grandmother or another residential arrangment approved by DOC 

Court addresses Defendant,  this is one last chance, consider this a gift, hoping that one will save Defendant.
20 days in which to appeal.
Grandmother can come and pick up Defendant after 17 days of jail.
(corrected due date)

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on July 26, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Darius J Hunt in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Darius J Hunt in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:22 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea today.

There is a plea. Defendant will plead to Count 1 in amended information.

State recommends a prison sentence of 24 mo initial confinement and 36 mo extended supervision, appropriate conditions. Defense is requesting a PSI. Conditions of supervision would be argued and 154 days credit as of today.

Atty Schmidt concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Copy of amended information is provided by Atty Cousins for the Court to review.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Atty Schmidt addresses the Court regarding Defendant's needs, are not affecting his decision ability today.

Defendant changes his plea to: GUILTY.

Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Voting rights are addressed.
Court questions Attorney Schmidt for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.

Defendant has not had a PSI done before.
PSI to be completed by July 20th. Copies forwarded to counsel so they can prepare.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Darius J Hunt in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Darius J Hunt in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:49 AM Court calls case.
There is a motion before the Court, motion to withdraw.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court regarding his motion to withdraw.
Defendant asked for a new attorney.

Defendant wishes a different attorney.

Court advises Defendant that this may delay the proceedings of the trial.
Defendant understands.

Defendant does not want to switch lawyers.
Defendant wants Atty Schmidt to stay on the case.

Atty Schmidt will discuss this with the Defendant for a few minutes, off the record.

8:53 AM Court is back on the record.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, Defendant would perfer to have him on this case.
Court questions Atty Schmidt.
Defendant concurs, does want Atty Schmidt to stay on the case.

BY THE COURT:
Court will take no action on the motion to withdraw since Defendant changed his mind and the record speaks for itself.
Bond is ordered continued.
